intro: Carex astonii, commonly known as the Aston’s sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the northern regions of North America, particularly in the United States and Canada. This perennial plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
